action.content:
You are a language wizard who likes to guess words by using the given rules.

Welcome to Wordle! You have six attempts to guess the target word, a valid English word of five lowercase letters (a-z). Please use the tags "explanation:" and "guess:" to provide a concise explanation for each guess.

For instance, if your guess is "apple", your response should be
explanation: this is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word.
guess: apple

After each guess, your answer will be validated, and you will receive feedback indicating which letters are correct (green), which letters are correct but in the wrong position (yellow), and which letters are incorrect (red). This feedback can be useful in determining which letters to include or exclude in your next guess.

For example, the feedback for "apple" might be:
guess_feedback: a<yellow> p<yellow> p<green> l<yellow> e<red>

The explanation should contain details about how the guess_feedback is used to arrive at a new guess.

Do not generate any other text.

Let's begin with your first guess.

explanation: This is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word to gather initial feedback.
guess: apple

attempts = 1
target_word = inbox
guess = apple
guess_feedback = a<red> p<red> p<red> l<red> e<red>

guess_feedback: a<red> p<red> p<red> l<red> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: All letters in "apple" are incorrect, so I will exclude these letters and try a completely different word.
guess: crane

attempts = 2
target_word = inbox
guess = crane
guess_feedback = c<red> r<red> a<red> n<yellow> e<red>

guess_feedback: c<red> r<red> a<red> n<yellow> e<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "n" is correct but in the wrong position, so I will include "n" in a different spot and exclude the other letters.
guess: snort

attempts = 3
target_word = inbox
guess = snort
guess_feedback = s<red> n<green> o<yellow> r<red> t<red>

guess_feedback: s<red> n<green> o<yellow> r<red> t<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "n" is in the correct position, and "o" is correct but in the wrong position. I will place "n" in the same spot and move "o" while excluding the other letters.
guess: loner

attempts = 4
target_word = inbox
guess = loner
guess_feedback = l<red> o<yellow> n<yellow> e<red> r<red>

guess_feedback: l<red> o<yellow> n<yellow> e<red> r<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "n" was marked yellow, meaning it is correct but in the wrong position. "O" is also correct but misplaced. I will rearrange "n" and "o" while excluding the other letters.
guess: onion

attempts = 5
target_word = inbox
guess = onion
guess_feedback = o<red> n<green> i<yellow> o<green> n<red>

guess_feedback: o<red> n<green> i<yellow> o<green> n<red>

Provide your response only in this format.
explanation: details
guess: word

explanation: The letter "n" is in the correct position, and "o" is also correct in its second occurrence. The letter "i" is correct but misplaced. I will rearrange "i" while keeping "n" and "o" fixed.
guess: toxin

attempts = 6
target_word = inbox
guess = toxin
guess_feedback = t<red> o<yellow> x<yellow> i<yellow> n<yellow>

guess_explanation: This is a common five-letter English word, and I am starting my guess with this word to gather initial feedback.
All letters in "apple" are incorrect, so I will exclude these letters and try a completely different word.
The letter "n" is correct but in the wrong position, so I will include "n" in a different spot and exclude the other letters.
The letter "n" is in the correct position, and "o" is correct but in the wrong position. I will place "n" in the same spot and move "o" while excluding the other letters.
The letter "n" was marked yellow, meaning it is correct but in the wrong position. "O" is also correct but misplaced. I will rearrange "n" and "o" while excluding the other letters.
The letter "n" is in the correct position, and "o" is also correct in its second occurrence. The letter "i" is correct but misplaced. I will rearrange "i" while keeping "n" and "o" fixed.
